title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open a file in multiple editors simultaneously
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, attempting to open it in another editor should display an error message. However, in the current state, no warning or error message is displayed and the file cannot be opened in multiple editors.
OB: The file can be opened in the workbench in one editor.
EB: When attempting to open the file in another editor, a warning message should be displayed indicating that the file is already opened and asking if the user wants to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed stating that all file instances need to be closed before opening. This is a safety feature implemented in WSAD to prevent external editing when the file is already opened in WSAD.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a java file in the workbench by double-clicking on it.
2. Right-click on the same java file and select 'Open With... System Editor'.

Expected result:
A warning message should be displayed informing the user that the file is already opened and asking if they want to continue.

Alternative expected result:
An error message should be displayed stating that all file instances need to be closed before opening in another editor.
